title: Watch: DECAPITATED Debuts Their New Vocalist Live
description: Plus some songs with ex-vocalist Wojciech "Sauron" Wasowicz.
author: Greg Kennelty
byline: By Greg Kennelty Published 5 hours ago
excerpt: Plus some songs with ex-vocalist Wojciech "Sauron" Wasowicz.
text: Decapitated hit the stage for the first time with new vocalist Eemeli Bodde (ex-Mors Subita) at Damnation Festival: A Night Of Salvation on November 1 and it was incredible! The set featured a handful of songs from The Negation featuring original vocalist Wojciech "Sauron" Wasowicz, alongside a boatload of classics. The set was also Decapitated's first performance since vocalist Rafał Rasta Piotrowski quit the band in October. The full setlist was: "The Fury" "Three-Dimensional Defect" (w/ Sauron) "Lying And Weak" (w/ Sauron) "Sensual Sickness" "The Negation" (w/ Sauron) "Long-Desired Dementia" "The Empty Throne" "Lunatic Of God's Creation" (Deicide cover) "Cancer Culture" "Just A Cigarette" "Earth Scar" "Last Supper" "Day 69" "Spheres Of Madness" (w/ Sauron) "Never" "Iconoclast" For real though, anyone else really looking forward to new Decapitated with Bodde on vocals? Dude sounded awesome. Want More Metal? Subscribe To Our Daily Newsletter Enter your information below to get a daily update with all of our headlines and receive The Orchard Metal newsletter.
html:
Decapitated hit the stage for the first time with new vocalist Eemeli Bodde (ex-Mors Subita) at Damnation Festival: A Night Of Salvation on November 1 and it was incredible! The set featured a handful of songs from The Negation featuring original vocalist Wojciech "Sauron" Wasowicz, alongside a boatload of classics. The set was also Decapitated's first performance since vocalist Rafał Rasta Piotrowski quit the band in October. The full setlist was:

  1. "The Fury"
  2. "Three-Dimensional Defect" (w/ Sauron)
  3. "Lying And Weak" (w/ Sauron)
  4. "Sensual Sickness"
  5. "The Negation" (w/ Sauron)
  6. "Long-Desired Dementia"
  7. "The Empty Throne"
  8. "Lunatic Of God's Creation" (Deicide cover)
  9. "Cancer Culture"
  10. "Just A Cigarette"
  11. "Earth Scar"
  12. "Last Supper"
  13. "Day 69"
  14. "Spheres Of Madness" (w/ Sauron)
  15. "Never"
  16. "Iconoclast"

For real though, anyone else really looking forward to new Decapitated with Bodde on vocals? Dude sounded awesome.
